problem: Let \( f(x) = \sqrt{3 - x} \) and \( g(x) =  rac{x}{x-2} \). Calculate \( f^{-1}(g^{-1}(4)) \).
solution: To solve for $f^{-1}(g^{-1}(4))$, we first find $g^{-1}(4)$: Set $g(x) = 4$ which gives $x/(x - 2) = 4$. Cross-multiply to get $x = 4(x - 2)$, leading to $-3x = -8$, so $x = 8/3$. Thus, $g^{-1}(4) = 8/3$. Next, find $f^{-1}(8/3)$: Start with $f(x) = \sqrt{3 - x}$, set $y = \sqrt{3 - x}$, square to get $y^2 = 3 - x$, so $x = 3 - y^2$. Thus, $f^{-1}(y) = 3 - y^2$. Now calculate $f^{-1}(8/3) = 3 - (8/3)^2 = 3 - 64/9 = 27/9 - 64/9 = -37/9$. Final result: $\boxed{-\frac{37}{9}}$.
